events.originalText: Two American journalists, having been arrested for illegal entry into North Korea, were sentenced to twelve years hard labor before being pardoned two months later.
events.subtitle: 2009 imprisonment of American journalists by North Korea
events.headline: American Journalists Sentenced to Hard Labor in North Korea

events.originalText: A Japanese man drove a truck into a crowd of pedestrians in Akihabara, Tokyo, and proceeded to stab at least 12 people, killing 7 and wounding 10, before being apprehended.
events.subtitle: 2008 Akihabara massacre
events.headline: Truck Attack in Akihabara, Tokyo Leaves 7 Dead

events.originalText: A major storm caused the bulk carrier Pasha Bulker to run aground in New South Wales, Australia.
events.subtitle: 2007 New South Wales storms
events.headline: Major Storm Causes Pasha Bulker to Run Aground in Australia

events.originalText: Falklands War: The Argentine Air Force attacked British transport ships while unloading supplies off Bluff Cove in the Falkland Islands, killing 56 British servicemen and wounding 150 others.
events.subtitle: Falklands War
events.headline: Argentine Air Force Attacks British Ships in Falklands War

events.originalText: Vietnam War: Associated Press photographer Nick Ut took a Pulitzer Prize–winning photograph of a naked nine-year-old Phan Thi Kim Phuc fleeing after being burned by napalm.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: Pulitzer Prize-Winning Photo Captures Vietnam War Tragedy

events.originalText: The Israeli Air Force attacked the U.S. Navy intelligence ship USS Liberty in international waters, killing 34 people and wounding 171 others.
events.subtitle: Israeli Air Force
events.headline: Israeli Air Force Attacks USS Liberty, Killing 34

events.originalText: An F5 tornado struck Flint and Beecher, Michigan, causing 116 fatalities, 844 injuries and $19 million in damage during a larger tornado outbreak sequence.
events.subtitle: 1953 Flint–Beecher tornado
events.headline: F5 Tornado Strikes Flint and Beecher, Michigan

events.originalText: Thomas Blamey became the only Australian to attain the rank of field marshal.
events.subtitle: Thomas Blamey
events.headline: Thomas Blamey Becomes Australia's Only Field Marshal

events.originalText: World War II: The Allies commenced the Syria–Lebanon campaign against Vichy French possessions in the Levant.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allies Begin Syria-Lebanon Campaign in World War II

events.originalText: Margaret Bondfield became the first female member of the Cabinet of the United Kingdom when she was named Minister of Labour by Ramsay MacDonald.
events.subtitle: Margaret Bondfield
events.headline: Margaret Bondfield Joins UK Cabinet as Minister of Labour

events.originalText: American Civil War: The Confederate Army won a resounding victory at the Battle of Cross Keys, one of the two decisive battles in Jackson's Valley Campaign.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Confederate Army Victorious at Battle of Cross Keys

events.originalText: In York, Upper Canada, members of the Family Compact destroyed William Lyon Mackenzie's printing press in the Types Riot after Mackenzie accused them of corruption.
events.subtitle: York, Upper Canada
events.headline: Family Compact Destroys Mackenzie's Printing Press in York

events.originalText: Laki, a volcanic fissure in Iceland (pictured), began an eight-month eruption, triggering a major famine and causing widespread fluoride poisoning.
events.subtitle: Laki
events.headline: Laki Volcanic Eruption Triggers Famine in Iceland

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: British forces defeated the Continental Army at the Battle of Trois-Rivières, the last battle of the American invasion of Quebec.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British Forces Defeat Continental Army at Battle of Trois-Rivières

events.originalText: Led by the inexperienced Gannys, Elagabalus's legions defeated the forces of Roman emperor Macrinus at the Battle of Antioch.
events.subtitle: Gannys
events.headline: Elagabalus's Legions Triumph at Battle of Antioch
